intro: Laserpitium asperum, commonly known as rough hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. It is often used in herbal medicine for its potential diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
